sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"大风"之意。
means: storm ： 指雷电交加的暴风雨，也多作引申用。
hurricane ： 指12级大风，有时指发生在西印度群岛的大气旋。
typhoon ： 主要指西太平洋海洋上发生的极猛烈的风暴，风力常达十级以上。

word_mean: 曾称“飓风”。蒲福风级的十二级风, 风速大于32.7m/s 。

sentence.Network_en: The agency was heavily criticised for its tardy response to the hurricane.
sentence.Network_cn: 该机构因对飓风反应迟缓，受到严厉批评。

sentence.Network_en: Hurricane Andrew was last night heading into the Gulf of Mexico.
sentence.Network_cn: 昨晚，飓风“安德鲁”进入了墨西哥湾。

sentence.Network_en: The eye of the hurricane hit Florida just south of Miami.
sentence.Network_cn: 飓风的风眼袭击了佛罗里达州迈阿密正南部。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Spanish huracán, probably from Taino hurakán 'god of the storm'

entry.def: A hurricane is an extremely violent wind or storm.

means.word_mean: 1. a severe tropical cyclone usually with heavy rains and winds moving a 73-136 knots (12 on the Beaufort scale)
